content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

You can solve this problem in Julia by using the built-in `lowercase`, `strip`, and `replace` functions from the Base. Here is the function:

```julia
function clean_column(col)
    return replace(replace(lowercase(strip(col))," ","_"), "-","_")
end
```
This function works by first converting the column name to lower case, removing any leading or trailing whitespaces using `strip`, and then replacing any spaces with underscores. Finally, it replaces any hyphens with underscores as well.
